framework.name: Zend Framework 2 Tool_1/8/14 2:18 PM_zf2

command.name: diag
command.help:
zftool.phar diag [options] [module name]run diagnosti
[module name](Optional) name of module to test
-v --verboseDisplay detailed information.
-b --breakStop testing on first failure
-q --quietDo not display any output unless an error occurs.
--debugDisplay raw debug info from tests.

command.name: config list
command.help: zftool.phar config list list all configuratio

command.name: config get
command.help: zftool.phar config get <name> display a single

command.name: config set
command.help: zftool.phar config set <name> <value>set a single config value

command.name: create project
command.help:
zftool.phar create project <path>create a skeleton
<path>The path of the project to be created

command.name: create module
command.help:
zftool.phar create module <name> [<path>]create a module
<name>The name of the module to be created
<path>The root path of a ZF2 application where to create the module

command.name: create controller
command.help:
zftool.phar create controller <name> <module> [<path>]create a controller in module
<name>The name of the controller to be created
<module>The module in which the controller should be created
<path>The root path of a ZF2 application where to create the controller

command.name: create action
command.help:
zftool.phar create action <name> <controllerName> <module> [<path>]create an action in a controller
<name>The name of the action to be created
<controllerName>The name of the controller in which the action should be created
<module>The module containing the controller
<path>The root path of a ZF2 application where to create the action

command.name: classmap generate
command.help:
zftool.phar classmap generate <directory> <classmap file> [--append|-a] [--overwrite|-w]
<directory>The directory to scan for PHP classes (use "." to use current directory)
<classmap file>File name for generated class map file or - for standard output. If not supplied, defaults to
--append | -aAppend to classmap file if it exists
--overwrite | -wWhether or not to overwrite existing classmap file

command.name: install zf
command.help:
zftool.phar install zf <path> [<version>]
<path>The directory where to install the ZF2 library
<version>The version to install, if not specified uses the last available

framework.help:
zftool.phar modules [list] show loaded modules
zftool.phar version | --versiondisplay current Zend Framework
zftool.phar diag [options] [module name]run diagnosti
[module name](Optional) name of module to test
-v --verboseDisplay detailed information.
-b --breakStop testing on first failure
-q --quietDo not display any output unless an error occurs.
--debugDisplay raw debug info from tests.
zftool.phar config list list all configuratio
zftool.phar config get <name> display a single
zftool.phar config set <name> <value>set a single config value
zftool.phar create project <path>create a skeleton
<path>The path of the project to be created
zftool.phar create module <name> [<path>]create a module
<name>The name of the module to be created
<path>The root path of a ZF2 application where to create the module
zftool.phar create controller <name> <module> [<path>]create a controller in module
<name>The name of the controller to be created
<module>The module in which the controller should be created
<path>The root path of a ZF2 application where to create the controller
zftool.phar create action <name> <controllerName> <module> [<path>]create an action in a controller
<name>The name of the action to be created
<controllerName>The name of the controller in which the action should be created
<module>The module containing the controller
<path>The root path of a ZF2 application where to create the action
zftool.phar classmap generate <directory> <classmap file> [--append|-a] [--overwrite|-w]
<directory>The directory to scan for PHP classes (use "." to use current directory)
<classmap file>File name for generated class map file or - for standard output. If not supplied, defaults to
--append | -aAppend to classmap file if it exists
--overwrite | -wWhether or not to overwrite existing classmap file
zftool.phar install zf <path> [<version>]
<path>The directory where to install the ZF2 library
<version>The version to install, if not specified uses the last available
